abstract.p: Felix Trinidad to fight Mamadou Thiam for World Boxing Assn superwelterweight title on July 22 (S)

block.p: Felix Trinidad, armed with a new five-fight HBO deal, will fight Mamadou Thiam for the World Boxing Association superwelterweight title on July 22, with hopes of meeting Fernando Vargas on TVKO pay-per-view in the fall.

Felix Trinidad, armed with a new five-fight HBO deal, will fight Mamadou Thiam for the World Boxing Association superwelterweight title on July 22, with hopes of meeting Fernando Vargas on TVKO pay-per-view in the fall.

''I'm prepared for anybody,'' Trinidad said yesterday at a news conference at a movie theater on Manhattan's East Side. ''Nobody can stop me. You can write that. I will continue to show the world I'm the best.''

The near term for Trinidad, whose record is 37-0, seems to exclude a rematch with Oscar De La Hoya, whom he defeated last September. Talks collapsed over De La Hoya's refusal to fight above 147 pounds, while Trinidad wants to fight at 151.
Vargas and De La Hoya are also under contract to HBO.

Trinidad's camp and HBO are plotting a course for the fighter to eventually move up in weight class to face Roy Jones Jr., the undisputed light-heavyweight champion, who is heading into the last bout in his HBO contract.

''When we realized we couldn't make a rematch with De La Hoya, we veered off in another direction,'' said Seth Abraham, the president of Time Warner Sports, referring to plans for Trinidad to bulk up to face Jones, at about 170 pounds.
